comments.body: since this is type-only, could you keep the name the same as before? Otherwise all the existing dependents have to change (as in rdjs__parser below)

Yes, I thought that might be a problem. The only breaking change I made was that I [removed](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/47364/files#diff-faf773fd4d0109e1c8cd2339c8acdb2e421f1c7072b426e18c067097bf84eb2fL18) the export of `Document` and `Context` (which aliased to `JsonLd|Url` and `Document` respectively) from `json-spec.d.ts`, and doing that required me to update the dependents as you noted.

I would prefer to keep the type names as close as possible to the [spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld11/), so maybe we can find a compromise. If I could re-add `Document` and `Context` back into `json-spec.d.ts`, but change their definitions from the old `JsonLd|Url` and `Document` types to the new `JsonLdDocument` and `ContextDefinition` types respectively, then I believe that would make the change non-breaking as well as keep the same names as before.
this might be worth keeping as `Document` too
